conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to calculate the area under the curves up to t = 10 seconds.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10 seconds to t = 20 seconds. Car B's velocity increases linearly over time.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds using the area of a triangle.
Distance_A = 200 meters for Car A from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
Determine the height of Car B's triangle since Car B is side by side with Car A at t = 30 seconds.
Calculate total distance for Car A from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds as 1000 meters.
Set up equation for Car B's area from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds to be 1000 meters.
Solve for height h of Car B's triangle as approximately 66.67 m/s.
Calculate height of Car B's triangle at t = 10 seconds as approximately 22.22 m/s.
Calculate distance_B for Car B from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds as approximately 111.1 meters.
Compare distances: Car A has traveled 200 meters and Car B has traveled approximately 111.1 meters by t = 10 seconds.
Car A is ahead of Car B at t = 10 seconds.
